src:
Luhut Wakili Jokowi Pimpin Delegasi Indonesia ke Cina
01 Nov 2019, 12:26 by Eko Wahyudi, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Direktur Jenderal Pengembangan Ekspor Nasional Kementerian Perdagangan Dody Edward mengatakan bahwa Menteri Koordinator Bidang Maritim dan Investasi Luhut Binsar Panjaitan akan memimpin delegasi Indonesia dalam ajang pameran perdagangan dunia di Cina. Pameran bertajuk China International Import Expo (CIIE) pada tahun kedua digelar di National Exhibition and Convention Center (NECC), Shanghai pada 5-10 November 2019.
"Yang diminta hadir adalah Presiden Joko Widodo, namun Pak Presiden menunjuk Pak Menko (Luhut) sebagai special envoy (utusan khusus)," kata Dody di kantornya, Jakarta, Jumat 1 November 2019.
Dia mengatakan, bahwa saat ini Indonesia tidak menjadi partner country (negara mitra) sehingga Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi tidak diwajibkan datang dalam ajang CIIE kali ini. Presiden Jokowi pun mengutus Luhut sebagai pemimpin perwakilan Indonesia.
CIIE merupakan pameran produk impor yang diselenggarakan Kementerian Perdagangan Cina (MOFCOM) yang menempati area seluas 500 ribu meter persegi. Pameran ini akan menampilkan produk impor dari 172 negara dan ditargetkan dikunjungi lebih dari 150 ribu orang.
Pameran dibagi dalam dua area yaitu Country Pavilion for Trade and Investment dan Enterprise and Business Exhibition. Country Pavilion for Trade and Investment merupakan area yang dikhususkan sebagai ruang pamer untuk menampilkan produk unggulan, informasi investasi, dan pariwisata dari negara peserta.
Pada pameran ini, Paviliun Indonesia menempati area seluas 136 meter persegi di Hall 5.2, yang akan menampilkan stan Perusahaan Gas Negara, Badan Koordinasi Penanaman Modal, dan PT Astra International.
Pada ajang tersebut Indonesia akan menampilkan produk unggulan dalam negeri seperti kelapa sawit, kopi, dan sarang burung walet, makanan dan minuman, aneka bumbu, biofuel, serta biji plastik. Selain itu, terdapat beberapa perusahaan Indonesia yang mengikuti pameran secara mandiri dengan mendaftar langsung ke panitia CIIE.
Cina sebagai mitra dagang terbesar bagi Indonesia dengan total perdagangan pada 2018 mencapai US$ 72,7 miliar. Sementara, pada Januari sampai Agustus 2019 total perdagangan kedua negara tercatat sebesar US$ 45,9 miliar.
text:
Luhut Represents Jokowi to Lead Indonesian Delegation to China
01 Nov 2019, 12:26 by Eko Wahyudi, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Director General of the Ministry of Trade's National Export Development Dody Edward said that the Coordinating Minister for Maritime and Investment Luhut Binsar Panjaitan will lead the Indonesian delegation at the world trade exhibition in China. The exhibition titled China International Import Expo (CIIE) in the second year was held at the National Exhibition and Convention Center (NECC), Shanghai on 5-10 November 2019.
"The one who was asked to attend was President Joko Widodo, but the President appointed Mr. Menko (Luhut) as special envoy (special envoy)," Dody said in his office, Jakarta, Friday, November 1, 2019.
He said that at this time Indonesia was not a partner country so President Joko Widodo or Jokowi were not required to attend the CIIE event this time. President Jokowi also sent Luhut as Indonesia's representative leader.
CIIE is an exhibition of imported products organized by the Ministry of Commerce of China (MOFCOM) which occupies an area of 500 thousand square meters. This exhibition will feature imported products from 172 countries and is targeted to be visited by more than 150 thousand people.
The exhibition is divided into two areas, namely the Country Pavilion for Trade and Investment and the Enterprise and Business Exhibition. The Country Pavilion for Trade and Investment is an area devoted as a showroom to display superior products, investment information, and tourism from participating countries.
At this exhibition, the Indonesian Pavilion occupies an area of 136 square meters in Hall 5.2, which will feature the booth of the State Gas Company, the Investment Coordinating Board, and PT Astra International.
At the event, Indonesia will display superior products in the country such as palm oil, coffee, and swallow's nests, food and beverages, various spices, biofuels, and plastic seeds. In addition, there are several Indonesian companies that participate in the exhibition independently by registering directly to the CIIE committee.
China as the largest trading partner for Indonesia with total trade in 2018 reached US $ 72.7 billion. Meanwhile, in January to August 2019 the total trade between the two countries was recorded at US $ 45.9 billion.
